>>ca57c91c-9c42-4218-b3d6-dc8c87814125
I am on linux, how do I configure zeronet to use tor? I have the latest version of zeronet but it just runs in terminal.

posts.subject: zeronet on tor with linux
posts.body:
how do you run zeronet with tor on linux tutorial

Zeronet with tor on linux (tutorial update):

1)
install zeronet-git from AUR

instructions for other distros can be found here:
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet

2)
install tor from AUR

3) edit torrc:
sudo nano /etc/tor/torrc
Remove the # character from lines ControlPort 9051 AND CookieAuthentication 1 (line ~57)
[code]
#add these settings to /etc/tor/torrc to make zeronet work with tor:
DataDirectoryGroupReadable 1
CookieAuthFileGroupReadable 1
ExtORPortCookieAuthFileGroupReadable 1
CacheDirectoryGroupReadable 1
CookieAuthFile /var/lib/tor/control_auth_cookie
[/code]

4) restart tor for changes to take effect:
sudo systemctl restart tor

5) Add tor to your user
if you are on arch/manjaro:
sudo usermod -a -G tor [yourlinuxusername]

if you are on ubuntu/debian/mint:
sudo usermod -a -G debian-tor [yourlinuxusername]

6) add tor user to zeronet:
arch/manjaro:
sudo usermod -a -G tor zeronet

debian/ubuntu/mint:
sudo usermod -a -G debian-tor zeronet

7)
Logout/Login of your system for usermod changes to take effect

8) Start tor:
sudo systemctl start tor

This was the tor configuration.

Tip: You can verify if your Tor setup is running correctly using
echo 'PROTOCOLINFO' | nc 127.0.0.1 9051
in terminal and to verify it works in zeronet enter in browser:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Stats
"Tor hidden services (status: OK"

==Configuring Zeronet to use tor==
Next you need to configure zeronet to run over tor.
you can do that here:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Config/

Tor: Always
Proxy for tracker connections: Tor

Clean tor tracker list:
https://pastebin.com/qqh7Z86b

and verify here:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Stats

>CAN'T UPLOAD IMAGE WITH TOR
You can change the following options to post images via TOR Browser:

>Go in about:config
>Type "fingerprint"
>Deactivate: 
privacy.resistFingerprinting
privacy.resistFingerprinting.autoDeclineNoUserInputCanvasPrompts
services.sync.prefs.sync.privacy.resistFingerprinting

Start zeronet:
sudo systemctl start zeronet
Stop zeronet:
sudo systemctl stop zeronet
testing image upload with tor
another image upload test

>>ee6ef0b3-be83-484f-8d8d-5987fce71d3d
>>c37aff9f-dd14-4833-a281-10afc0c42139
>>5349647b-880e-49d1-9dbf-9f926fb16bef
here in your configuration you can add the trackers:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Config/

>>9b2dcc3a-cfd4-4762-9778-f6ba48bc1e51
>I also can't access zeronet from the actual tor browser itself either, but its working in other browsers.
go in firefox to:
about:preferences

scroll down: Network Proxy --> Settings --> no proxy for 127.0.0.1

try this:
sudo /etc/init.d/tor start
sudo rc-service tor start
sudo systemctl start tor
sudo systemctl start debian-tor

did you edit /etc/tor/torrc?

>>bbe557e8-faef-45bf-ae2c-e31716a9f2bf
I think you didn't configure zeronet to use tor or used a meek bridge.
bump new update
testing image upload
another test

>>27589104-8ed6-4a59-8295-2562edce028f
thank you based /g/entooman

edit:
if sudo systemctl status tor gives error messages like:
[code]
[NOTICE] We tried for 15 seconds to connect to '[scrubbed]' using exit
[/code]

the solution is to remove the state file in /var/lib/tor/state

so:
